# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(str::AbstractString; text_width::Int = 10)
    lines = []
    for word in split(str, " ")
        if length(word) > text_width
            throw(ErrorException("Word '$word' exceeds maximum text width of $text_width characters."))
        end
        push!(lines, word)
        if (i = findnext(r"\s", str, nextind(str, endof(word)))) !== nothing && i - 1 > text_width
            push!(lines, "")
        end
    end
    return join(lines, "\n")
end

# Example usage:
julia> wrap_string("Hello there, how are you today? This is a very long sentence that should wrap after 10 characters per line.")
"Hello there,
how are you today?
This is a very
long sentence that
should wrap after
10 characters per
line."
```
